intro: Cyrtandromoea minor, commonly known as the small cyrtandromoea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, such as montane forests. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
